page.title: 12WESTBURY HOSPITAL
page.content: The buildings at the end of Hospital Road were officially opened in 1931. There are 24 beds in 5 wards, Mens,Womens,Calloway,(used as an over- flow ward) and 2 side wards. The hosp- ital is usually full to capacity. Out- patients and minor casualties are also treated. The medical staff comprises 30 people working in shifts. There is a visiting chaplain,an attached Social Worker and ancilliary staff who deal with catering and cleaning. Dirty laundry is sent to Roundway Hospital,Devizes. Minor surgery is carried out in the operating theatre,provided as a result of fundraising by the League of Friends of Westbury Hospital. Patients requiring major operations are taken to the Royal United Hospital, Bath.The day to day running costs are funded by the Bath Area Health Authority.
